player_decision.reason: T7 suited is a playable hand on the button. Raising to isolate or steal the blinds, continuing an aggressive strategy to build my stack in the tournament.
SB with 25o versus a 3x open; out of position with ~19.5bb effective and a player behind. Hand plays terriblyâ€”preserve stack and fold.

Calling allows defending the big blind with Ace-suited, maintaining pot control and preserving chips while keeping the hand playable post-flop. Given Alice's aggression and previous tendencies to fold under pressure, taking a cautious approach here avoids unnecessary risk with a marginal hand.

Given the pair of 4s with Ace kicker, checking (Call) to evaluate Alice's action is prudent. This allows controlling the pot size and avoids committing chips unnecessarily. If Alice bets post-check, her action can be reassessed based on bet size and perceived strength, but with the current marginal hand, maintaining pot control is strategic.

As the preflop aggressor on the button, I should make a continuation bet on this flop to apply pressure and potentially take down the pot with fold equity, given my gutshot straight draw and the board texture.

With a pair of 4s and a nut flush draw, the hand has significant equity (~35%) against Alice's likely range. The aggressive all-in move puts maximum pressure on Alice, folds out weaker hands, and maximizes fold equity. Considering tournament dynamics and needing to accumulate chips, this calculated risk is justified.

My hand is Ts 7h on a 9s Jh 4d flop, giving me only a gutshot straight draw to an 8. With approximately 17% equity against a likely strong range for CharlieAI's check-raise all-in, and pot odds requiring about 30% equity to call 115 into a 260 pot, folding preserves my stack of 150 for better spots in the tournament.
